newsArray.description: De la premi√®re finale africaine de l'USM Alger en 2015, il ne subsiste qu'un seul joueur, le gardien Mohamed Lamine Zemmaouche qui √† 38 ans entame une pr√©-retraite reste toujours proche du terrain. Officiellement 3e gardien derri√®re Benbot et Benchlef cette saison, l'exp√©riment√© international Zemmamouche qui n'a disput√© que 4 matchs la saison pass√©e mais [‚Ä¶] The post USMA : Zemmaouche le survivant de 2015 appeared first on Football Alg√©rien - DZFOOT.COM.
newsArray.content: De la premi√®re finale africaine de l'USM Alger en 2015, il ne subsiste qu'un seul joueur, le gardien Mohamed Lamine Zemmaouche qui √† 38 ans entame une pr√©-retraite reste toujours proche du terrain. Officiellement 3e gardien derri√®re Benbot et Benchlef cette saison, l'exp√©riment√© international Zemmamouche qui n'a disput√© que 4 matchs la saison pass√©e mais aucun en 2022/2023, pourra r√©clamer une part du troph√©e africain en cas de cons√©cration ce soir, puisqu'il √©tait sur le banc face √† Saint Eloi Lupopo le 12 f√©vrier. Avec 410 matchs en 18 saisons √† l'USMA (entrecoup√©es de deux ans au MCA), Zemmamouche est de loin le joueur le plus cap√© de l'histoire de l'USM Alger avec qui il a connu ces vingt derni√®res ann√©es toutes les campagnes continentales et r√©gionales. En 2013 il est dans les buts quand l'USMA gagne la Coupe Arabe face √† Al Arabi, en 2015 il est le gardien malheureux en finale face au TP Mazembe en finale de Ligue des Champions √† Bologhine. C'√©tait encore lui le gardien en 2017 quand l'USM Alger est sortie cette fois en demi-finale de C1 par le Wydad Casablanca. Il est encore de la derni√®re grande d√©ception usmiste en 2018 avec une d√©faire en 1/4 de finale de la Coupe de la CAF 1-0 contre Al Masry √† S√©tif. Malgr√© ces d√©ceptions Zemmamouche √† tout de m√™me remport√© trois titres de champions et deux coupes d'Alg√©rie avec l'USMA, une exp√©rience qui sera utile √† un groupe assez jeune. DZfoot

newsArray.title: Bellarmine homecoming: Who is David Diaz-Infante and what are his plans for Bells‚Äô football program?
creator: Darren Sabedra
newsArray.description: David Diaz-Infante, a two-time Super Bowl champion, returns to San Jose to coach storied Bellarmine football team.
newsArray.content: SAN JOSE ‚Äî David Diaz-Infante played for Jack Elway and Claude Gilbert at San Jose State and Mike Shanahan with the Denver Broncos. He blocked for John Elway in a pro career that stretched well over a decade. Since retiring with two Super Bowl rings on his fingers, he has worked for ESPN as a broadcaster and helped coach in the NFL. Now, Diaz-Infante is coming home. And to hear him tell it, he couldn‚Äôt be happier about moving from Arizona to take over as the football coach of his high school alma mater, Bellarmine College Prep. ‚ÄúNo one has what Bellarmine has,‚Äù Diaz-Infante, 59, told the Bay Area News Group. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the history and tradition of one of the oldest high schools in the state of California and with a rich and incredible tradition of football and doing great things.‚Äù Diaz-Infante‚Äôs buddies from back when he was a team captain at the San Jose Jesuit school in the early 1980s nudged him toward adding his name to the list of candidates when Jalal Beauchman in late March. Friday, Bellarmine announced that . ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been an interesting journey in itself, much like my journey,‚Äù Diaz-Infante said with a laugh. At first, Diaz-Infante wasn‚Äôt sure he wanted to leave his home of 15 years in Arizona, his family‚Äôs bubble of friends and interests. But the more calls he received about the Bellarmine opening, the more sense it made to apply. Diaz-Infante played on the school‚Äôs first Central Coast Section championship team in 1981. ‚ÄúThis is the way I can have an impact on some young men like Bellarmine had an impact on me,‚Äù Diaz-Infante said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been blessed to be around a lot of good coaches and teachers of the game. The game has been good to me, and I think I have been good to the game.‚Äù Diaz-Infante called his time with Denver in the late-1990s the highlight of his playing career, which included stops in the World League of American Football and the Canadian Football League. With Denver, Diaz-Infante said he made his living as a sixth man on the line. ‚ÄúI always tell people, ‚ÄòLook, I was a good player. I was not a great player. But I learned what it meant to be a great teammate,‚Äù Diaz-Infante said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what it takes to win it all. It was really special to be a part of those teams. ‚ÄúOur offensive line probably epitomized that more than anything, of what it takes to win and the work you have to put in and the dedication and the unselfishness.‚Äù No doubt, those are intangibles that Diaz-Infante will try to instill in his new team. The coach spent 20 minutes on Friday in a phone interview with the Bay Area News Group. Here is what he said (edited for clarity and brevity): What is your plan of attack, given that it‚Äôs early June and the season is just a few months away? ‚ÄúI am in discussions with people right now (for the staff). I have some people that have been around the game for a long time that have expressed interest in working with me and we‚Äôre working on some of those details right now. Guys that have a lot more experience than me. ‚Ä¶ We‚Äôre going to have some great coaches and some great teachers and that‚Äôll help the program all the way through. Guys with experience and guys that love the game and share the same values. I am so excited about that because I don‚Äôt know it all. But I made a living being coachable, and I‚Äôll remain coachable. I‚Äôve been around some great coaches and I‚Äôve always taken note of how they do things and why they do them. I‚Äôve been around them when they work and when they don‚Äôt work.‚Äù Ideally, when would you want to meet with your team? ‚ÄúI plan on getting back early next week and stopping by myself. Introduce myself to the team.‚Äù The West Catholic Athletic League has changed quite a bit since you were playing for the Bells. As you look at the landscape of the league, what do you see? ‚ÄúLike it always has been, I see one of the best leagues there is. There is probably more parity today than ever with the addition of Valley Christian (in the early 2000s) and I know Serra is a very good football team and St. Francis and Mitty. Shoot, everybody is good ‚Äî SI, Riordan and Sacred Heart. The league is as tough as it‚Äôs ever been. There are some great coaches.‚Äù Not a lot of people go from Arizona to San Jose these days. (Diaz-Infante will also have a staff position with Bellarmine‚Äôs Office of Advancement, according to the school.) (Laughs). ‚ÄúThe more me and my wife talked and my kids ‚Äî they‚Äôre grown but we always make decisions as a family ‚Äî they said, ‚ÄòYou‚Äôve got to do it.‚Äô I‚Äôm really humbled by the opportunity, that people thought that highly of me to really put the full-court press on me. And I‚Äôll be home. I used to always tell people, I‚Äôll always be a Bell and San Jose will always be my home. And, obviously, I enjoyed a great deal of success at San Jose State as well. It‚Äôs very near and dear to my heart. I still have a lot of incredible friends and family (in the area).‚Äù Mark Schlereth (now a broadcaster) was on those Denver offensive lines. What does he think about your new job? ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs one of my best friends. I am going to see him tomorrow. He‚Äôll be down to visit I am sure when I am coaching there. He was as excited as I was, I think. That‚Äôs the kind of relationship we have. I would practice for him when his body was too beat up. We‚Äôve remained close over the years because of those things.‚Äù

newsArray.title: Bob Raissman: Be a shock if Tom Brady bailed on Fox TV gig to return to the field
creator: Tribune News Service
newsArray.description: When May turned into June, Aaron Rodgers had company when it came to generating NFL buzz. There was Patrick Mahomes and questions about whether he is capable of building a dynasty in Kansas City. Brady wants to shut the spec down, but the hubbub is terrific for his nascent TV career at Fox Sports, where he‚Äô s currently the number-one-game-analyst-in waiting,...
newsArray.content: When May turned into June, Aaron Rodgers had company when it came to generating NFL buzz. There was Patrick Mahomes and questions about whether he is capable of building a dynasty in Kansas City. Then there was the man who supposedly won‚Äôt set foot on the field again ‚Äî the budding TV star, Tom Brady. Suddenly, after he purchased a stake in the team, and because of , speculation bubbled about Brady ending up quarterbacking the Las Vegas Raiders. On Thursday, even after Brady told Sports Illustrated‚Äôs Robin Lundberg: it didn‚Äôt deter some of the football cognoscenti from speculating that once training camp rolls around, Brady could get the itch to return to the field. Brady wants to shut the spec down, but the hubbub is terrific for his nascent TV career at Fox Sports, where he‚Äôs currently the number-one-game-analyst-in waiting, scheduled to enter the booth in the 2024 season and replace Greg Olsen. Brady‚Äôs ability to sustain buzz and generate attention is just one reason Fox suits signed him to . That he‚Äôs taking a year off before starting the gig signifies his commitment to TV. With Brady taking the 2023 season ‚Äúoff,‚Äù Fox has an unprecedented opportunity to tutor Brady. He will have the freedom to do ‚Äúpractice‚Äù games from an auxiliary booth in stadiums during live action. He also can get a feel of what his routine will be like during the season. Fox execs will also have the time to start ‚Äúhorse trading‚Äù for marquee matchup games for Brady to work in 2024. There are other valid reasons why Brady‚Äôs playing days should be over. 1) The Fox contract. Just over $37 million per to work basically once a week for five months a year is incentive enough. 2) More importantly: Brady‚Äôs made a career of hard work, preparation, determination, dedication and proving people wrong. That‚Äôs his motivation. It will be no different in TV, especially when other networks, Valley of the Stupid Gasbags, and broadcasting agents start sniping at him and nitpicking his performance in the booth. Finally, never once in his storied career has Brady backed down from a challenge, which TV ‚Äî initially ‚Äî will be. Those who say Brady has changed his mind before are correct. Yet this is a different time in his life. To see him bail on Fox would be a shocker. If anyone thinks Brady being a part owner of the Raiders will be seen by the NFL as a conflict of interest, or short-circuit his Fox gig, keeping him out of the network‚Äôs NFL booth, think again. TV executives and leagues have already set precedent in that regard. Earvin (Magic) Johnson was a panelist on ESPN/ABC‚Äôs ‚ÄúNBA Countdown‚Äù when he owned an undisclosed stake in the Lakers. If the NFL was concerned with conflicts they could ‚Äúremind‚Äù Fox that Brady should not work any Raiders games. Or just spin it, saying Brady has the chops to be impartial. And he doesn‚Äôt believe in passing info from coach to coach. Pat McAfee, and his viewers/listeners have been fretting over whether his show, with its cast of thousands, will change when it moves to ESPN. An inordinate amount of time has been used to ponder this life-or-death question. Moses, er, McAfee has already come down from the mountaintop to deliver his I-got-to-be-me sermon to a few different outlets. Another question worth squeezing in is: Will the coming of McAfee‚Äôs show change the way other ESPN programs do business? After all, ESPN boss Jimmy Pitaro has described how McAfee, and his show, generates ‚Äúaudience expansion.‚Äù So, ESPN producers know, even if just in the back of their mind, ‚Äúwhat Jimmy wants.‚Äù Nonetheless, for the past couple of years, ESPN has spent time emphasizing the benefits of hard news (‚ÄùGet Up,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis Just In‚Äù) and a more measured approach. The rationale is, for example, when hard news breaks on ‚ÄúFirst Take,‚Äù it will dominate the show, no matter what the plan is. Same holds true on ‚ÄúNFL Live‚Äù and ‚ÄúNBA Today.‚Äù McAfee‚Äôs soiree is more free-form. The show can get into personal issues as well as dissecting games and newsy/noisy interviews, like . ESPN is betting $85 million over five years that McAfee‚Äôs show will attract new eyeballs to ESPN. If it does, will other ESPN offerings mimic it? For the old adage in sports TV is this: Stealing is believing. Michael Kay did an admirable job of shielding the Yankees from criticism about their streaming situation, until his shell game became apparent. Yankee games streaming on Peacock and Apple+? ‚ÄúThe Yankees had nothing to do with games on Apple and Peacock. That‚Äôs the greed of Major League Baseball‚Ä¶,‚Äù Kay said on his ESPN-98.7 show. Well, what is MLB? It‚Äôs actually a company operated and owned by the baseball owners, including Yankee boss Hal Steinbrenner. He has to sign off on these TV deals so you CAN blame the Yankees for Apple+ and Peacock. And the 20 games the Yankees stream on Amazon Prime Video used to be on ‚Äúfree‚Äù TV Ch.11 where a subscription fee was not necessary. The Knicks parted ways with GM Scott Perry and team prez Leon (Sphinx) Rose was nowhere to be found to explain why. How shocking! ‚Ä¶ Talk about an unprecedented NFL season. While remote, there is actually a possibility in December out of those windows (TNF, SNF, and MNF) and three more attractive games to be flexed in. That‚Äôs 12 teams out of 32 in the league in the entire league being impacted by Roger Goodell‚Äôs determination to boost viewership numbers, which in many cases are already spectacular. ‚Ä¶ Peter Rosenberg (ESPN-98.7) recently made plenty of sense when he pointed out the ridiculous nature of trying to micro-analyze Mets and Yankees games, the day after on a daily basis, during what is the longest season. He didn‚Äôt come out and say the day-after analysis makes for boring, repetitive, radio, but came awfully close. Bravo! ‚Ä¶ Don La Greca, on 98.7, neatly straddled the line between lunacy and passion last Wednesday when he defended the ‚Äúsanctity‚Äù of the Yankees jersey, railing against those who would allow any sort of advertising on the uniform top. Ironically Michael Kay didn‚Äôt have a problem with an ad patch. Remember? This is the guy who, when describing the back of the Yankee jersey during radiocasts, coined the phrase, ‚Äúno name‚Ä¶.of course‚Äù and made it famous. * * * For his creativity and consistency. The veteran producer (27 years) of TNT‚Äôs critically acclaimed ‚ÄúInside the NBA,‚Äù retired following the Eastern Conference Finals. Kiely did so knowing he ushered in and developed a studio show that maintained its quality, energy and quirkiness. For hyping a CBS Mornings‚Äô ‚Äúinterview‚Äù with Alex Rodriguez as ‚Äúexclusive.‚Äù The spot was basically an infomercial where A-Rod ‚Äúrevealed‚Äù he had recently been diagnosed with gum disease and has partnered with a health company to help raise ‚Äúawareness‚Äù about the ailment. What said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm certain I‚Äôm not playing again, so I‚Äôve tried to make that clear, and I hate to continue to profess that‚Ä¶.‚Äù What meant to say: ‚ÄúAt least for today, I‚Äôm certain I‚Äôm not playing again.‚Äù ()

newsArray.title: Saturday Sport: Manchester derby in FA Cup final, Cork host Kerry
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: A busy day of sporting action in football and GAA.
newsArray.content: Soccer Manchester United can scupper Manchester City's treble ambitions in the FA Cup Final this afternoon. Premier League champions City will hope to seal the Cup today, before the Champions League final next weekend. Kick off at Wembley is at 3.00. At the same time, Barcelona and Wolfsburg will contest the Women's Champions League final in Eindhoven. Celtic can wrap up a domestic treble this afternoon - they face Inverness in the Scottish Cup final from 5.30. GAA Kildare meet Dublin in Kilkenny this evening, in Group 3 of the All Ireland Football Championship. P√°irc U√≠ Chaoimh hosts Group 1‚Äôs heavyweight contest between Cork and Kerry at 3:00. In Group 2, Galway and Armagh have a quarter-final spot in their sights as they face Westmeath and Tyrone respectively There‚Äôs hurling silverware galore up for grabs at Croke Park this afternoon. Advertisement Monaghan meet Lancashire in the Lory Meagher Cup final - that's just throwing in now. That‚Äôs followed at 3 by Donegal‚Äôs clash with Wicklow in the Nickey Rackard decider. And promotion to the Joe McDonagh is on the line as Meath play Derry in the Christy Ring Cup final from 5.00. Golf Sport Max Verstappen tops rain-hit final practice for Sp... Read More Tom McKibbin is in a tie for the lead at the European Open in Hamburg. The Holywood clubman is on 6-under-par midway through his third round, alongside David Law of Scotland. Racing Frankie Dettori [Pronounced: DEH-TOH-REE] will be on board Arrest for his final Epsom Derby, which goes to post at half 1. There are also 7-race cards at Listowel from twenty five past two, and Tramore from half five. X

newsArray.title: Meath vs Down LIVE score updates from Tailteann Cup Round Three tie
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Paddy Tierney)
newsArray.description: The Mournemen side need a win or a draw against the Royals to progress straight through to the Tailteann Cup quarter-finals
newsArray.content: Meath and Down meet in a top-to-the-table clash in Parnell Park this afternoon with a home Tailteann Cup quarter-final spot on offer. With two wins from two, both counties are already guaranteed at least a preliminary quarter-final berth. The draw for the preliminary quarter-finals will take place after the last of the group games tomorrow evening, but the four teams who top the groups will progress straight through to the last eight of the competition and will have an extra week off. Meath and Down are two of the outright favourites for the competition and could well meet again later in the summer. The Royals have endured a difficult season under new manager Colm O‚ÄôRourke and their loss to Offaly coupled with their sixth place finish in Division Two saw them fail to secure a place in the Sam Maguire Cup. As a Division Three team, Down needed to reach the Ulster Final to avoid the Tailteann Cup, but lost out to Armagh in the semi-final after beating Donegal in Newry. Conor Laverty‚Äôs side need only a draw to top the group due to their superior scoring difference over Meath. We‚Äôll have all the latest team news ahead of throw-in at 1pm.
